tasks.task: Operating a four-foot tiller on farm land.
subtasks: Hooking up the tiller to the tractor's quick hitch.
Adjusting the slip clutch on the tiller.
Starting the tractor and engaging the PTO.
Driving the tractor with the tiller attached to till the land.
Adjusting the depth of the tiller blades.
Making multiple passes over the same area to achieve desired tilling depth.
Comparing tilling results to previous plowing with an all-purpose plow.
Evaluating the consistency of the seedbed created by the tiller.
Planting a screening cover after tilling.

tasks.task: Using a four-foot ideal tiller for tilling and planting.
subtasks: Unpacking and setting up the tiller.
Attaching the tiller to the tractor.
Checking and adding oil to the tiller's gearbox.
Adjusting the tilling depth using the skid runner bolts.
Conducting multiple passes to achieve sufficient tilling depth.
Weeding and debris removal before tilling.

tasks.task: Evaluating tiller vs. all-purpose plow effectiveness.
subtasks: Observing the tiller and plow results side by side.
Comparing the consistency of the seedbed created by both methods.
Measuring the depth of tilled soil with the plow vs. tiller.
Assessing the need for additional passes with the plow.

tasks.task: Addressing remaining areas that need tilling.
subtasks: Identifying un-tILLED sections and determining appropriate action.
Adjusting pass speed and depth as needed for remaining areas.

tasks.task: Demonstrating farmer's preferences and equipment features.
subtasks: Highlighting the smooth ride and efficiency of the tiller.
Discussing the potential for adding more blades to the tiller.
Mentioning other compatible accessories for the tractor.
Recommending wheel spacers for tractors with cabs.

tasks.task: Introducing plans for planting screening cover and future food plots.
subtasks: Exploring the benefits of the giant screening cover.
Announcing collaboration with Northwoods Whitetails.
Promoting their online resources and subscription for viewers.
